Determine the impedance of a transmission line, given the physical dimensions
Determine the gain of an antenna given the physical and electrical parameters
Determine the loss/100 feet of a transmission line, given the velocity factor and conductor materials ~~

questions.explanation: Determine the length and position of an impedance matching stub

questions.text: On the Smith chart shown in Figure E9-3, what is the name for the large outer circle on which the reactance arcs terminate?
questions.explanation: Reactance axis

questions.text: On the Smith chart shown in Figure E9-3, what is the only straight line shown?
questions.explanation: The resistance axis ~~

questions.text: How is a Smith chart normalized ?

answers.text: Reassign the reactance axis with resistance values
Reassign the resistance axis with reactance values
Reassign the prime center’s impedance value
Reassign the prime center to the reactance axis ~~

questions.explanation: Reassign the prime center’s impedance value

questions.text: What third family of circles is often added to a Smith chart during the process of designing impedance matching networks ?
questions.explanation: Constant - SWR circles

questions.text: What do the arcs on a Smith chart represent?
questions.explanation: Points with constant reactance ~~

questions.text: In what units are the wavelength scales on a Smith chart calibrated?

answers.text: In fractions of transmission line electrical frequency
In fractions of transmission line electrical wavelength
In fractions of antenna electrical wavelength
In fractions of antenna electrical frequency ~~ E9H Receiving a ntennas: radio direction finding (RDF) techniques ; Beverage antennas; single- and multiple-turn loops

questions.explanation: In fractions of transmission line electrical wavelength

questions.text: When constructing a Beverage antenna, which of the following factors should be included in the design to achieve good performance at the desired frequency?

answers.text: Its overall length must not exceed 1/4 wavelength
It must be mounted more than 1 wavelength above ground
It should be configured as a four-sided loop
It should be at least one wavelength long ~~

questions.explanation: It should be at least one wavelength long ~~

questions.text: Which is generally true for 160 - and 80 - meter receiving antennas?

answers.text: Atmospheric noise is so high that directivity is much more important than losses
They must be erected at least 1/2 wavelength above the ground to attain good directivity
Low loss coax transmission line is essential for good performance

questions.explanation: Atmospheric noise is so high that directivity is much more important than losses

questions.text: What is r eceiving d irectivity f actor (RDF)?

answers.text: Forward gain compared to the gain in the reverse direction
Relative directivity compared to a dipole
Peak a ntenna gain compared to average gain over the hemisphere around and above the antenna ~~

questions.explanation: Peak a ntenna gain compared to average gain over the hemisphere around and above the antenna ~~

questions.text: What is the purpose of placing a n electrostatic shield around a small - loop direction-finding antenna?

answers.text: It adds capacitive loading, increasing the bandwidth of the antenna
It eliminates unbalanced capacitive coupling to the antenna’s surroundings, improving the depth of its nulls
It eliminates tracking errors caused by strong out-of-band signals
It increases signal strength by providing a better match to the feed line ~~

questions.explanation: It eliminates unbalanced capacitive coupling to the antenna’s surroundings, improving the depth of its nulls

questions.text: What challenge is presented by a small wire-loop antenna for direction finding?

answers.text: It has a bidirectional null pattern
It does not have a clearly defined null
It is practical for use only on VHF and higher bands

questions.explanation: It has a bidirectional null pattern

questions.text: What indicates the correct value of terminating resistance for a Beverage antenna?

answers.text: Maximum feed point DC resistance at the center of the desired frequency range
Minimum low-angle front-to-back ratio at the design frequency
Maximum DC current in the terminating resistor
Minimum variation in SWR over the desired frequency range ~~

questions.explanation: Minimum variation in SWR over the desired frequency range ~~

questions.text: What is the function of a Beverage antenna’s termination resistor ?

answers.text: Absorb signals from the reverse direction

questions.explanation: Absorb signals from the reverse direction

questions.text: What is the function of a sense antenna?

answers.text: It modifies the pattern of a DF antenna to provide a null in only one direction
It increases the sensitivity of a DF antenna array
It allows DF antennas to receive signals at different vertical angles
It provides diversity reception that cancels multipath signals ~~

questions.explanation: It modifies the pattern of a DF antenna to provide a null in only one direction

questions.text: What type of radiation pattern is created by a single-turn, terminated loop such as a pennant antenna ?
questions.explanation: Cardioid

questions.text: How can the output voltage of a multiple-turn receiving loop antenna be increased?

answers.text: By reducing the permeability of the loop shield
By utilizing high impedance wire for the coupling loop
By increasing the number of turns and/or the area enclosed by the loop

questions.explanation: By increasing the number of turns and/or the area enclosed by the loop

questions.text: What feature of a cardioid pattern antenna makes it useful for direction - finding antennas ?

answers.text: High radiation angle ~~ SUBELEMENT E0 - SAFETY - [1 exam question - 1 group] E0A Safety: RF radiation hazards; hazardous materials; grounding

questions.explanation: A single null

questions.text: What is the primary function of an external earth connection or ground rod?

answers.text: Prevent static build up on power lines
Reduce RF current flow between pieces of equipment
Protect breaker panel from power surges ~~

questions.explanation: Lightning charge dissipation

questions.text: When evaluating RF exposure levels from your station at a neighbor’s home, what must you do?

answers.text: Ensure signals from your station are less than the controlled m aximum p ermissible e xposure (MPE) limits
Ensure signals from your station are less than the uncontrolled m aximum p ermissible e xposure (MPE) limits
Ensure signals from your station are less than the controlled m aximum p ermissible e mission (MPE) limits
Ensure signals from your station are less than the uncontrolled m aximum p ermissible e mission (MPE) limits ~~

questions.explanation: Ensure signals from your station are less than the uncontrolled m aximum p ermissible e xposure (MPE) limits

questions.text: Over what range of frequencies are the FCC human body RF exposure limits most restrictive?
When evaluating a site with multiple transmitters operating at the same time, the operators and licensees of which transmitters are responsible for mitigating over-exposure situations?

answers.text: Each transmitter that produces 20 percent or more of its MPE limit in areas where the total MPE limit is exceeded
Each transmitter operating with a duty cycle greater than 25 percent
Each transmitter that produces 5 percent or more of its MPE limit in areas where the total MPE limit is exceeded
Each transmitter operating with a duty cycle greater than 50 percent ~~

questions.explanation: Each transmitter that produces 5 percent or more of its MPE limit in areas where the total MPE limit is exceeded

questions.text: What hazard i s created by operating at microwave frequencies ?

answers.text: The high gain antennas commonly used can result in high exposure levels
Microwaves are in the frequency range where wave velocity is higher
The extremely high frequency energy can damage the joints of antenna structures ~~

questions.explanation: The high gain antennas commonly used can result in high exposure levels

questions.text: Why are there separate electric (E) and magnetic (H) MPE limits at frequencies below 300 MHz ?

answers.text: The body reacts to electromagnetic radiation from both the E and H fields
Ground reflections and scattering cause the field strength to vary with location
E field and H field radiation intensity peaks can occur at different locations

questions.explanation: All these choices are correct ~~

questions.text: What is meant by “100% tie-off” regard ing tower safety?

answers.text: All loose ropes and guys secured to a fixed structure
At least one lanyard attached to the tower at all times
All tools secured to the climber’s harness
All circuit breakers feeding power to the tower must be tied closed with tape, cable, or ties ~~

questions.explanation: At least one lanyard attached to the tower at all times

questions.text: What does SAR measure?

answers.text: The rate at which RF energy is absorbed by the body
The rate of RF energy reflected from stationary terrain ~~

questions.explanation: The rate at which RF energy is absorbed by the body

questions.text: Which of the following types of equipment are exempt from RF exposure evaluations ?

answers.text: Transceivers with less than 7 watts of RF output
Antennas that radiate only in the near field
Dish antennas less than one meter in diameter ~~

questions.explanation: Hand-held transceivers sold before May 3, 2021

questions.text: When must an RF exposure evaluation be performed on an amateur station operating on 80 meters ?

answers.text: An evaluation must always be performed
When the ERP of the station is less than 10 watts
When the station’s operating mode is CW
When the output power from the transmitter is less than 100 watts ~~

questions.explanation: An evaluation must always be performed

questions.text: To what should lanyards be attached while climbing?
questions.explanation: Tower legs ~~

questions.text: Where should a shock-absorbing lanyard be attached to a tower when working above ground?

answers.text: To the belt of the fall-arrest harness
To the next lowest set of guys ~~ ~~~end of question pool text~~~ NOTE: The graphics required for certain questions in sections E5, E6, E7, and E9 are included on the following pages.

questions.explanation: Above the climber’s head level
